results.title: Repulsion motor principles
results.creator_credit: United States. Office of Education and Ray-Bell Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Electrical work: electrical machinery”.
Explains construction of repulsion motor, rotor circuits and effects of brush position; short-circuiting and brush-lifting mechanism; and application of repulsion motors. This film is a technical training film on the design and construction of repulsion brush type electric A.C. motors as used in the first half of this century.
results.creator_credit_for_label: United States. Office of Education and Ray-Bell Films

results.title: Squirrel-cage rotor principles
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Electrical work: electrical machinery”.
Laws of magnetism and induced electromagnetic fields.; electric flow in squirrel-cage rotor setting up magnetic poles which create torque; construction of squirrel-cage rotors.

results.title: Single-phase and polyphase circuits
results.creator_credit: Ray-Bell Films and United States. Office of Education
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Electrical work: electrical machinery”.
A training film explaining a single-phase synchronous generator; the use of sine curves to illustrate flow change; a two-phase system and three-phase system and ways to simplify wiring.

results.title: Split-phase motor principles
results.creator_credit: Ray-Bell Films and United States. Office of Education
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Electrical work: electrical machinery”.
Construction of stator and rotor; comparison of winding in two-phase stator with split-phase stator; effects of winding resistances and inductive reactances; and use of capacitor to produce phase displacement.

results.title: Electricity Safety
results.media_note: Sorry, we don't have images or video for this item.

group_works.title: New cords for old, and the golden rule
group_works.creator_credit: Australian Instructional Films, Lex Halliday and Instructional Films for S E C

results.title: New cords for old, and the golden rule
results.creator_credit: Australian Instructional Films, Lex Halliday and Instructional Films for S E C
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Electricity Safety”.
Do not keep old damaged electrical cords, and never try to repair them. Common causes of accidents are frayed cords, and badly repaired cords, broken plugs, and two cord flexes used instead of three cord flexes. Once insulation becomes worn or damaged wires are exposed which may cause shocks. Hows correct way of wiring new plugs and recommends that it is a job for an expert.

results.title: Decreasing inappropriate behaviours (TEFC): reinforcement procedure
results.creator_credit: John Socha and Macomb Community College Instructional Television
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Effective Behavioural Programming”.
Tape 4 : Discusses procedures for decreasing inappropriate behaviours within the least restrictive model of treatment. This model ranks the procedures according to their evasiveness, severity, and intrusiveness. When decreasing inappropriate behaviours, the teacher should only move to the next procedure if the current procedure is ineffective. NB. This videotape plays on 525 line NTSC
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Socha and Macomb Community College Instructional Television

results.title: Discovering reinforcers (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: John Socha and Macomb Community College Instructional Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Effective Behavioural Programming”.
Tape 1 : The use of reinforcers in the classroom is the key to motivating students. Reinforcers are events that follow a response and increase the probability that the response will occur again. Retarded people have fewer reinforcers. It is important for a teacher to discover appropriate reinforcers for the particular class NB. This tape is on 525 line NTSC.
